definition: wheelwork consisting of a connected set of rotating gears by which force is transmitted or motion or torque is changed, exercise in order to prepare for an event or competition
details:
noun
- wheelwork consisting of a connected set of rotating gears by which force is transmitted or motion or torque is changed
= example: wheelwork consisting of a connected set of rotating gears by which force is transmitted or motion or torque is changed
= synonyms: gear
- public transport provided by a line of railway cars coupled together and drawn by a locomotive
= example: public transport provided by a line of railway cars coupled together and drawn by a locomotive
= synonyms: railroad train
- piece of cloth forming the long back section of a gown that is drawn along the floor
= example: piece of cloth forming the long back section of a gown that is drawn along the floor
- a series of consequences wrought by an event
= example: a series of consequences wrought by an event
- a procession (of wagons or mules or camels) traveling together in single file
= synonyms: caravan, wagon train
- a sequentially ordered set of things or events or ideas in which each successive member is related to the preceding
= synonyms: string
verb
- exercise in order to prepare for an event or competition
= example: exercise in order to prepare for an event or competition
- undergo training or instruction in preparation for a particular role, function, or profession
= example: undergo training or instruction in preparation for a particular role, function, or profession
= synonyms: prepare
- create by training and teaching
= example: create by training and teaching
= synonyms: develop
- teach and supervise (someone)
= example: teach and supervise (someone)
= synonyms: coach
- point or cause to go (blows, weapons, or objects such as photographic equipment) towards
= synonyms: aim
- drag loosely along a surface
= synonyms: trail
- travel by rail or train
= synonyms: rail
- educate for a future role or function
= synonyms: groom, prepare
- teach or refine to be discriminative in taste or judgment
= synonyms: school, cultivate, civilize, civilise, educate
- cause to grow in a certain way by tying and pruning it
= example: cause to grow in a certain way by tying and pruning it
- develop (children's) behavior by instruction and practice
= synonyms: discipline
